reviews.text: Ballylinny cottages are in an area with lovely views of the gorgeous Antrim coast. They are a 15 min walk or few minutes drive to some of the loveliest beaches that I've seen, its a great location. A 10-15 min walk will take you to a lovely pub, The Nook, just at the Giant's Causeway which is a super sight. 5 min walk is a tiny steam railway that our kids loved. The cottages are in a cluster but despite proximity to other cottages feel private and we didn't have noise issues. They are simply furnished but with everything you need (e.g. hairdryers, hoover, washing machines...) - think whitewashed walls and pine floors rather than flowery carpets/curtains and nic-nacs. If you want lovely scenary, great walking and beaches and a clean uncluttered house to come home to, this is for you. Alan, the owner is super, extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pristine cottages - everything you need and nothing you don't

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed the August bank holiday weekend at Ballylinny cottages. The cottage we stayed in was well maintained, comfortable, clean and had all the services and appliances you could hope for in a self catering cottage. The scenery was beautiful and the location in relation to all the local attractions was superb. The village of Bushmills is under 2 miles away should you need anything during your stay. I would highly recommend these cottages to anyone interested in a break on the North Coast. The manager / owner Alan is friendly and couldn't be more helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely Weekend

reviews.text: I visited Ballylinny Cottages as part of a group of 14 friends visiting Ireland. The cottages provided an excellent base for seeing the Causeway Coast region. Located within easy walking distance of the Atlantic, the Giant’s Causeway, and the town of Bushmills, the cottages have plenty of room, contain most modern appliances, and are very neat.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed by all

reviews.text: The manager, Alan Laverty, proved to be very helpful to us on several occasions (including upgrading us to larger cottages as our group grew in size). The only drawbacks we had were with the wireless internet on site (sometimes a little spotty with reception—but it was for no extra charge) and the washer/dryer—the machine washed well, but had to be one of the slowest dryers in the world.
reviews.title: Best place to stay with young children
ballylinny cottages (the bungalow)
reviews.text: If you are looking for clean, spacious accommodations in a relaxed setting for a reasonable price, I highly recommend Ballylinny Cottages. I have been there twice and thoroughly enjoyed both visits.

reviews.title: lacks a personal touch
reviews.text: spacious , barn type conversions furnished in a contemporary style . we checked in on an icy cold day and there was no personal touch- no heating was on , no one to greet us ( though there was an apology).After self check in via coded keysafe, took ages to heat up the place and overall was a comfortable stay but some of the furniture starting to show age. On the positive side, location , views and free wifi are nice
Everything was excellent for our family. Large spaces with everything we needed. The owner was execelent and help us with anything we needed (which wasn't much). thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay with excellent host

reviews.text: My husband, father and I stayed in Wee Stookan for one week in July 2011. This was our first trip to NI (from Australia) and I wanted to stay in a cottage close to the Causeway Coast to use as a base for exploring. It turned out to be better than I had expected.
reviews.title: Wee Stookan was great

reviews.text: I spoke with Alan the owner & host via telephone on two occasions to book and make payment and he followed up promptly with emails to confirm our discussions. Upon arrival he wasn't in (he left a note for us) and upon calling he returned quickly to show us around the cottage and explain the heating system which was easy to use.
reviews.title: Wonderful scenery, disappointed with fittings in the cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cottage was great and had all the major items you need to be self sufficient, eg washing machine, dishwaher, small fridge, hairdryer, tv, linen, clothes airer, vacuum cleaner, jug, toaster, microwave, oven and crockery etc. The cottage was quiet considering it is attached to a larger cottage. Even though it was summer, it was a bit chilly at night and early morning; although using the heating solved this problem.
reviews.title: IMMACULATE LOFT APARTMENT

reviews.text: Stayed here with a group of friends (7 in total) and our 5 month old baby for just the one night as part of a quick tour of Northern Ireland.
reviews.title: A stones throw from the Causeway!!

reviews.text: These are located just a few hundred yards from the magnificent Giant's Causeway just outside Bushmills.
reviews.title: Wonderful, Magical, Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cottages are amazing, totally clean, spacious, modern but yet with an old style feel. All mod cons included, patio area out back, cleaning products, towels, delf, pretty much everything and not badly priced either.
reviews.title: Excellent cottages - highly recommended

reviews.text: We really should have stayed 2 nights as was long day from Dublin with Titanic museum and Belfast Murals tour taken in also (both terrific and reviewed also)
reviews.title: Good accomodation.

reviews.text: I took a party of almost 30 friends from all over the world to the Ballylinny cottages to celebrate my Civil Partnership and two weeks later we are still talking about how wonderful the cottages were to stay in!
reviews.title: Beautiful base to see the Antrim coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like to just go and relax here and get away from everyday things back at home. This is the place to come! There a cottages to choice from, our favourite one is Portnaboe because it has a view.
reviews.title: love it here

reviews.text: We stayed in Weirs Snout and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. This is our second time back although it did take us 11 years to get back! (Shame on us) As before everything was clean and tidy with everything you would need crockery and cutlery wise, however make sure you bring your own tea/coffee/sugar etc with you. The views are spectacular with the Giants Causeway literally a stones throw away, and our three kids (11,8 and 6) really had a ball, so much so they did not want to come home. So much to do and see and yet such a relaxing chilled out break. You cant go far wrong with Ballylinney and with Alan on hand to answer your questions you'll have a great time.
reviews.title: Superb Family Accommodation

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at Ballilinny Cottages. Manager Alan is a nice and helpful man. We stayed in weird's snout. 3 bedrooms and 2bathrooms. The cottage is nice, but certainly not 5 star.The kitchen is very nice and all comfort present. Nice little fireplace. Bedrooms ok. The shower downstairs en the bathroom upstairs need redecorating. For the price we payed, we got our money's worth. It is an excellent base to visit the coast . 1.5 hour ride to Belfast and 40 mins to Derry. If you are not looking for a luxurious stay, i would certainly recommend these cottages.
reviews.title: Quality for your money

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights and had one of the most relaxing and pleasant breaks by the sea! I stayed at Lacada cottage which was beautiful, warm and cosy with all the mod cons available. Everything is provided here as part of a self-catering vacation. Scenery is spectacular, the views look out to the sea and Giants Causeway. The host, Alan, was welcoming and friendly. My experience from start to finish was a very positive one and i would highly recommend staying here to anyone considering this magnifent location.
reviews.title: Excellent base to enjoy the North Antrim Coast!!

reviews.text: We stayed at one of the loft apartments at Ballylinny, and used it as a base to explore the Causeway Coast.
reviews.title: You can't get a better location for the Giant's Causeway
